title: Super Nada (2012)
overview: Guto, aspiring actor, dreams of hitting the big-time in São Paulo. He takes classes, rehearses, works out, auditions. He knows his big chance could find him anyplace, at any moment. His idol and role model is Zeca, an old-school TV comedian who—even on his last legs— still lives on in the hearts of a generation. When their paths intersect, Guto’s luck begins to change. But is that really possible?
storyline: Guto battles to establish himself as a performer, to win recognition for his talent. After countless auditions, he's cast for a sketch on the weekly show that stars Zeca, an old-fashioned, popular comic and Guto's boyhood idol. It seems Guto's luck has finally changed. But has it?
plot: The film follows the story of Guto, an actor who lives in São Paulo and dreams to become a great actor. He prepares, practicing, and going to all auditions, believing that his big chance may come anytime. His greatest idol is Zeca, an old comedian, somewhat decadent, but that still inspires a generation. Their paths are crossed and the luck starts to change for Guto.
